caption: Table 1: Implicit vs. Hierarchical Entropy Modeling Methods.
description: This table compares the performance of different entropy modeling methods used in PerCoV2, a perceptual image compression system.  It shows the bit-rate savings achieved by using implicit hierarchical VAR and different masking schemes (Checkerboard, Quincunx, QLDS) compared to a baseline method, for both ultra-low and extreme-low bit-rate settings.  The results highlight the impact of the chosen entropy model on compression efficiency.

caption: Table 2: Computational Complexity.
description: This table presents a comparison of the computational complexity of three different models: PerCo (SD v2.1), PerCo (SD v3.0), and PerCoV2 (SD v3.0).  For each model, it shows the average encoding and decoding time in seconds on the Kodak dataset at a bitrate of 0.03 bits per pixel (bpp).  The results highlight the relative computational efficiency of the models, considering both the encoding and decoding stages of the compression process.  It is important to note that the reported times exclude the initial three samples to account for device warm-up effects, and that these times were obtained using full precision (float32), so further speed improvements are expected with the use of lower precision.
